description: I've been using Master PDF for a few years now on Ubuntu. It keeps getting better. Amazing value for such a feature rich product.
summary: The best PDF editor for Linux

description: Even the free trial version is useful. This software is probably the best PDF editor out there on any platform. Allowss a wide range of editing, merging, printing, exporting facilities, drills right into the core of text and objects in a .pdf document. Updated very regularly. Focuses equally on Linux. Developer is responsive to bugs and feedback.

Regular updates of the software, responsive people. Pays equal attention to the Linux version. Not 5 stars as the documentation in the help center online could be better. If digital signatures are necessary in your work, it's worth paying the commercial version
summary: Probably one of the best (if not the best) Linux PDF Software
The best PDF editor I've seen so far

description: This pdf editor served me so well, that I bought 2 licences.
Good but not perfect, though I do not know any other better software on linux. Foxit Phantom pdf is better but sadly does not work on linux.
summary: Good but features could be improved

description: Until now the best editor for pdfs. If you need a pdf changed or a watermark removed this is it. However you need to buy a licence
Great product. Worth the money for a license.

Until July 2020 I had to use Foxit Phantom (running under WINE in 
Kubuntu 18.04) for multipage printing when printing short runs of booklets with foldings, 8 pages per sheet. Now MasterPDF has stepped up to Multipage printing, and it works beautifully. Wish list is now to be able to adjust the gutter width between pages printed on a sheet.
Thank You Master PDF
Recommended and worth the annual service fee.
summary: Now with Poster and Multipage printing

description:
Works very well, is my main pdf system on linux.
I have two small issues...
Updating is a pain, its not automatic on ubuntu.

Comments applied via sticky notes (esp from other applications) are not shown on screen. Theres no way to zoom out to show them.

this is an absolute life saver for editing regular pdf files that have text or tick boxes. 
Only wish it was free and open source
I have been using this software for about 5 years now and it is without a doubt one of the best PDF editors I have used. So simple to use and fairly light weight on resources.

The interface can be improved and the linux version does not work exactly the same as the windows version (my impression). Nevertheless, it is a very good software to work cross-platform. I have used the support and it is fast and efficient. I am happy to work with it even though it is not a cheap option.
Bon logiciel pour ubuntu mais un peu cher. On ne peut rien faire sans payer. Filigrane à la clef.

功能比较强大。推荐使用。
不是免费软件。未注册会在保存时嵌入水印。
